task.title: Editing Properties
task.shortdesc: In data preview, you can edit stage properties to see how the changes affect preview data. For example, you might edit the expression in an Expression Evaluator to see how the expression alters data.

context.p: data previewediting propertiesWhen you edit properties, you can test the change with the existing preview data or you can refresh the preview data.

When changing properties in the origin, refresh the preview data to test your changes. Refreshing the preview data allows the to use the latest origin properties to process preview data instead of using the cached data.Unlike changes to data, you cannot automatically revert property changes. Manually revert any changes that you do not want to preserve.

step.cmd: To edit stage properties while in data preview, select the stage you want to edit and click the Stage Configuration icon: .
To test properties changed in the origin, click the Refresh Preview icon: .
step.info: This refreshes the preview data. Based on the origin type, it might use the same data or a new set of data with the updated origin properties.
To test properties in any non-origin stage using the same set of data, click the Run With Changes icon: .

step.cmd: If you want to revert your change, manually change the property back.
